intro: Viola hortensis, commonly known as the garden violet, is a flowering plant belonging to the Violaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been widely cultivated in gardens around the world. Viola hortensis typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers well-drained soil and partial shade. It is often grown for ornamental purposes and can also be used in traditional herbal medicine.
